name: Babai's problem
summary: Babai's problem from 1979 refers to an unsolved problem in algebraic graph theory regarding the intersection of the longest cycles in a graph. More specifically, it asks whether in a \(3\)-connected graph with a longest cycle of length \(c\), any two longest cycles must intersect in at least \(f(c)\) vertices, where \(f(c)\rightarrow \infty \) as \(c\rightarrow \infty \). The term is also associated with a different problem in computer science, the graph isomorphism problem, which László Babai worked on and made a breakthrough in 2015.
